@Adel-Magebinary Can you provide some additional context about what was happening when the crash occurred? It looks like your system doesn't support stack traces, so it's hard to identify the root cause from what you provided.

I just feel like cpu threads counts are the issue because SmartOS exposes all CPUs to the container and only configured cpu threads can be used. Maybe redis is thinking wow, 32 threads CPU, let's use all of it whereas only 8 threads are allowed?
```
# It is possible to pin different threads and processes of Redis to specific
# CPUs in your system, in order to maximize the performances of the server.
# This is useful both in order to pin different Redis threads in different
# CPUs, but also in order to make sure that multiple Redis instances running
# in the same host will be pinned to different CPUs.
#
# Normally you can do this using the "taskset" command, however it is also
# possible to this via Redis configuration directly, both in Linux and FreeBSD.
#
# You can pin the server/IO threads, bio threads, aof rewrite child process, and
# the bgsave child process. The syntax to specify the cpu list is the same as
# the taskset command:
#
# Set redis server/io threads to cpu affinity 0,2,4,6:
# server_cpulist 0-7:2
#
# Set bio threads to cpu affinity 1,3:
# bio_cpulist 1,3
#
# Set aof rewrite child process to cpu affinity 8,9,10,11:
# aof_rewrite_cpulist 8-11
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8509094/116056963-7028d800-a6d2-11eb-9484-2d72a70203c6.png)
@Adel-Magebinary so it crashed right on startup, and it never worked for you in that configuration / setup?
did you enable any of the `*_cpulist` configs?
@oranagra  it doesn't crash when it starts. It starts when there is sadd into smembers from Magento 2. And I did not enable cpulist configs.

@Adel-Magebinary AFAIK SmartOS is a Solaris based system, so we could be running into some unexpected compatibility issue here and unfortunately we don't even have a backtrace to work with because of the alpia/libmusl image. Is it possible for you to see if it reproduces on a non-alpine image?
@yossigo I should be able to easily reproduce the issue with buster images.  I will get the team to reproduce it and post it back tomorrow.

@yossigo here is a reproduction of crash, backtrace from Redis 6.2.2-buster image when it is crashed

it's an access violation in (segmentation fault in dictAddRaw), not in any other function (unless inline), and certainly not in any other library.
dictAddRaw doesn't call any libpthread.so function (not directly and not indirectly).
what happens is that a signal handler is executed and it prints it's own stack, that can include the signal handler function (we skip it), and the function that called it (a function in libpthread.so)
